body.p: “Stopped by the culvert opposite the centaurea “,” to look at the sagittara leaves. Perhaps this plant is in its prime (?). Its leaves vary remarkably in form. I see “,” in a thick patch six or eight feet in diameter “,” leaves nearly a foot long of this form: [image] and others “,” as long or longer “,” of this form: [image] with all the various intermediate ones. The very narrow ones “,” perhaps “,” around the edge of the patch “,” being also of a darker green “,” are not distinguished at first “,” but mistaken for grass.”
PE 14, pg. 103-104 / 9 July 1858-9 November 1858 / NNPM MA 1302:33 / T vol. # XXVII / PDF # XVII / JXI
